api/FlowGraph.Avalonia.Animation.Animati.title: Enum AnimationCategory | FlowGraph
api/FlowGraph.Avalonia.Animation.Animati.summary: Enum AnimationCategory Namespace FlowGraph.Avalonia.Animation Assembly FlowGraph.Avalonia.dll Categorizes animations by their type for state management. public enum AnimationCategory Fields Edge = 3 Edge animations (fade, pulse, flow). Group = 4 Group animations (collapse, expand). Layout = 5 Layout transition animations. NodeAppearance = 2 Node appearance animations (fade, scale). NodePosition = 1 Node position animations. Other = 6 Generic/other animations. Viewport = 0 Viewport animations (pan, zoom, fit-to-view).

api/FlowGraph.Avalonia.Animation.html.title: Namespace FlowGraph.Avalonia.Animation | FlowGraph
api/FlowGraph.Avalonia.Animation.html.summary: Namespace FlowGraph.Avalonia.Animation Classes AnimationCategoriesChangedEventArgs Event args for animation category changes. AnimationManager Manages running animations and coordinates frame updates. BoxSelectionAnimation Animates a box selection rectangle. CategorizedAnimationWrapper Wrapper that adds category information to any animation. DelayAnimation A delay animation that does nothing for a specified duration, then completes. Useful for sequencing animations with pauses. Easing Easing functions for animations. EdgeColorAnimation Animates an edge's stroke color. EdgeFadeAnimation Animates an edge's opacity for fade in/out effects. EdgeFlowAnimation Animates an edge's stroke dash offset for a "flow" effect. EdgePulseAnimation Animates an edge's stroke thickness for pulse/highlight effects. GenericAnimation A generic animation that calls an update action with the normalized progress (0-1). Useful for simple animations or sequencing multiple animation phases. GroupChildrenFadeAnimation Animates children of a group fading in or out. GroupCollapseAnimation Animates a group's collapse or expand transition. LayoutAnimation Animates a set of nodes from their current positions to target positions. Intended for layout transitions (auto-layout, arrange, etc.). MultiEdgeFadeAnimation Animates multiple edges simultaneously with the same animation parameters. MultiNodeAnimation Animates multiple nodes' positions simultaneously. MultiNodeAppearAnimation Animates multiple nodes appearing/disappearing simultaneously. NodeAnimation Animates a node's position. NodeAppearAnimation Combines fade and scale for a complete appear/disappear effect. NodeFadeAnimation Animates a node's opacity for fade in/out effects. NodeScaleAnimation Animates a node's scale for pop/shrink effects. ParallelAnimation A group of animations that run in parallel. SelectionBorderAnimation Animates a node's selection border fading in. SelectionPulseAnimation Animates a selection highlight pulse effect. SequenceAnimation A sequence of animations that run one after another. ViewportAnimation Animates viewport transitions (pan and zoom). Interfaces IAnimation Represents an animation that can be updated over time. ICategorizedAnimation Extended animation interface that includes category information. Enums AnimationCategory Categorizes animations by their type for state management.

api/FlowGraph.Avalonia.Controls.NodeTool.title: Enum NodeToolbarPosition | FlowGraph
api/FlowGraph.Avalonia.Controls.NodeTool.summary: Enum NodeToolbarPosition Namespace FlowGraph.Avalonia.Controls Assembly FlowGraph.Avalonia.dll Defines the position of the NodeToolbar relative to the selected node(s). public enum NodeToolbarPosition Fields Bottom = 1 Below the node(s). Left = 2 To the left of the node(s). Right = 3 To the right of the node(s). Top = 0 Above the node(s).

api/FlowGraph.Avalonia.Controls.PanelPos.summary: Enum PanelPosition Namespace FlowGraph.Avalonia.Controls Assembly FlowGraph.Avalonia.dll Defines the position of a FlowPanel relative to its container. public enum PanelPosition Fields BottomCenter = 7 Bottom-center of the container. BottomLeft = 6 Bottom-left corner of the container. BottomRight = 8 Bottom-right corner of the container. Center = 4 Center of the container. CenterLeft = 3 Center-left of the container. CenterRight = 5 Center-right of the container. TopCenter = 1 Top-center of the container. TopLeft = 0 Top-left corner of the container. TopRight = 2 Top-right corner of the container.

api/FlowGraph.Avalonia.Controls.html.title: Namespace FlowGraph.Avalonia.Controls | FlowGraph
api/FlowGraph.Avalonia.Controls.html.summary: Namespace FlowGraph.Avalonia.Controls Classes ContextMenuEventArgs Event args for context menu opening. FlowBackground A customizable background control for FlowCanvas with multiple pattern variants. Inspired by React Flow's Background component. FlowCanvasContextMenu Provides context menu functionality for FlowCanvas. FlowControls FlowDiagnostics FlowMinimap FlowPanel A positioned overlay panel that can be placed at various positions within a FlowCanvas. Inspired by React Flow's Panel component. NodeToolbar A floating toolbar that appears near selected nodes. Inspired by React Flow's NodeToolbar component. Enums BackgroundVariant Background pattern variants for the flow canvas. NodeToolbarPosition Defines the position of the NodeToolbar relative to the selected node(s). PanelPosition Defines the position of a FlowPanel relative to its container.

api/FlowGraph.Avalonia.FlowCanvasSetting.summary: Class FlowCanvasSettings Namespace FlowGraph.Avalonia Assembly FlowGraph.Avalonia.dll Configuration settings for the FlowCanvas control. public class FlowCanvasSettings Inheritance object FlowCanvasSettings Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Properties AutoRouteEdges Whether automatic edge routing is enabled. When enabled, edges will be routed around obstacles automatically. public bool AutoRouteEdges { get; set; } Property Value bool ConnectionSnapDistance Distance in screen pixels within which a connection will snap to the nearest compatible port. Set to 0 to disable snap-to-port behavior. public double ConnectionSnapDistance { get; set; } Property Value double DebugCoordinateTransforms Whether to output debug information for coordinate transformations. public bool DebugCoordinateTransforms { get; set; } Property Value bool Default Default settings instance. public static FlowCanvasSettings Default { get; } Property Value FlowCanvasSettings DefaultEdgeType The default edge type to use for newly created edges. public EdgeType DefaultEdgeType { get; set; } Property Value EdgeType DefaultRouterAlgorithm The default router algorithm to use for routing. public RouterAlgorithm DefaultRouterAlgorithm { get; set; } Property Value RouterAlgorithm DirectRenderingNodeThreshold Gets or sets the node count threshold for automatically enabling direct rendering. When the graph has more nodes than this threshold, DirectGraphRenderer is automatically used. Set to 0 to disable auto-switching. Default is 100. public int DirectRenderingNodeThreshold { get; set; } Property Value int Remarks Direct rendering bypasses the Avalonia visual tree and draws directly to a DrawingContext, providing significantly better performance for large graphs (500+ nodes). EdgeEndpointHandleSize Size of edge endpoint handles in pixels. public double EdgeEndpointHandleSize { get; set; } Property Value double EdgeHitAreaWidth Width of the invisible hit area for edge click detection (in pixels). Higher values make edges easier to click but may overlap with other elements. public double EdgeHitAreaWidth { get; set; } Property Value double EffectiveSnapGridSize Gets the effective snap grid size. public double EffectiveSnapGridSize { get; } Property Value double EnableEdgeLabelEditing Whether double-clicking an edge triggers a label edit request. When enabled, double-clicking raises the EdgeLabelEditRequested event. public bool EnableEdgeLabelEditing { get; set; } Property Value bool EnableGroupLabelEditing Whether double-clicking a group triggers a label edit request. When false, double-click toggles collapse (default behavior). When true, double-click raises NodeLabelEditRequested for the group. public bool EnableGroupLabelEditing { get; set; } Property Value bool EnableNodeLabelEditing Whether double-clicking a node triggers a label edit request. When enabled, double-clicking raises the NodeLabelEditRequested event. public bool EnableNodeLabelEditing { get; set; } Property Value bool EnableVirtualization Gets or sets whether virtualization is enabled. When enabled, only nodes and edges visible in the viewport are rendered. This significantly improves performance for large graphs (500+ nodes). Default is true. public bool EnableVirtualization { get; set; } Property Value bool GridDotSize Size of grid dots in pixels. public double GridDotSize { get; set; } Property Value double GridSpacing Spacing between grid dots in pixels. public double GridSpacing { get; set; } Property Value double GroupBackgroundOpacity Opacity of the group background (0.0 to 1.0). Lower values create more translucent groups. public double GroupBackgroundOpacity { get; set; } Property Value double GroupBorderRadius Border radius for group corners. public double GroupBorderRadius { get; set; } Property Value double GroupHeaderHeight Height of the group header area. public double GroupHeaderHeight { get; set; } Property Value double GroupPadding Padding around children when auto-sizing groups. public double GroupPadding { get; set; } Property Value double GroupUseDashedBorder Whether to use dashed borders for groups (React Flow style). public bool GroupUseDashedBorder { get; set; } Property Value bool MaxZoom Maximum zoom level. public double MaxZoom { get; set; } Property Value double MinZoom Minimum zoom level. public double MinZoom { get; set; } Property Value double NodeHeight Height of nodes in pixels. public double NodeHeight { get; set; } Property Value double NodeWidth Width of nodes in pixels. public double NodeWidth { get; set; } Property Value double PanOnDrag Whether left-click drag on empty canvas pans (true) or starts box selection (false). When true, use Shift+drag for box selection. When false, use Shift+drag or middle-click for panning. public bool PanOnDrag { get; set; } Property Value bool PanOnScroll Whether to pan the viewport when scrolling (mouse wheel without Ctrl). When true: scroll = pan, Ctrl+scroll = zoom When false: scroll = zoom (default behavior) public bool PanOnScroll { get; set; } Property Value bool PanOnScrollSpeed Speed multiplier for pan-on-scroll behavior. Higher values result in faster panning. public double PanOnScrollSpeed { get; set; } Property Value double PortSize Size of connection ports in pixels. public double PortSize { get; set; } Property Value double RenderBatchSize Gets or sets the batch size for rendering nodes. When rendering large graphs, nodes are rendered in batches to keep the UI responsive. Set to 0 to disable batching (render all at once). Default is 50. public int RenderBatchSize { get; set; } Property Value int RouteEdgesOnDrag Whether to re-route edges while dragging nodes. Only applies when AutoRouteEdges is enabled. Set to false for better performance with many edges. public bool RouteEdgesOnDrag { get; set; } Property Value bool RouteNewEdges Whether to automatically route newly created edges. When true, edges created by connecting ports will be routed immediately. public bool RouteNewEdges { get; set; } Property Value bool RouteOnlyAffectedEdges Whether to route only edges connected to dragged nodes during drag. When true, only affected edges are re-routed (better performance). When false, all edges are re-routed (more consistent but slower). public bool RouteOnlyAffectedEdges { get; set; } Property Value bool RoutingNodePadding Padding around nodes for edge routing calculations. Higher values create more space between edges and nodes. public double RoutingNodePadding { get; set; } Property Value double SelectionMode Selection mode for box selection. public SelectionMode SelectionMode { get; set; } Property Value SelectionMode ShowBackground Whether to show the built-in canvas background color. Set to false when using a custom FlowBackground control so it can show through. public bool ShowBackground { get; set; } Property Value bool ShowEdgeEndpointHandles Whether to show draggable handles at edge endpoints for reconnecting/disconnecting edges. public bool ShowEdgeEndpointHandles { get; set; } Property Value bool ShowGrid Whether to show the built-in grid background. Set to false when using a custom FlowBackground control. public bool ShowGrid { get; set; } Property Value bool SnapConnectionToNode Whether to snap connections to nodes when dragging near them. When true, dragging near a node will find the nearest compatible port. public bool SnapConnectionToNode { get; set; } Property Value bool SnapGridSize Grid size for snapping (can differ from visual grid). If null, uses GridSpacing. public double? SnapGridSize { get; set; } Property Value double? SnapToGrid Whether to snap nodes to the grid when dragging. public bool SnapToGrid { get; set; } Property Value bool StrictConnectionDirection Whether connections can only be started from output ports. When true (default), dragging from an input port will not start a new connection. When false, connections can be started from either input or output ports (bidirectional). public bool StrictConnectionDirection { get; set; } Property Value bool UseProxyPortsOnCollapse Whether to use proxy ports when groups are collapsed. When true, edges that cross group boundaries are re-routed to proxy ports on the collapsed group, maintaining visual connectivity. When false (default), edges to/from hidden nodes are simply hidden. public bool UseProxyPortsOnCollapse { get; set; } Property Value bool UseSimplifiedNodeRendering Gets or sets whether to use simplified node rendering for better performance. When enabled, nodes use a minimal visual tree (single Border + TextBlock). Recommended for graphs with 500+ nodes. Default is false. public bool UseSimplifiedNodeRendering { get; set; } Property Value bool ViewportBounds Optional bounds to constrain panning. If set, the viewport cannot pan outside these bounds. Use null for unconstrained panning. public Rect? ViewportBounds { get; set; } Property Value Rect? ViewportBoundsPadding Padding inside the viewport bounds. Only applies when ViewportBounds is set. public double ViewportBoundsPadding { get; set; } Property Value double VirtualizationBuffer Gets or sets the buffer (in canvas coordinates) around the viewport for virtualization. Nodes within this buffer are still rendered even if slightly outside the viewport. This prevents "popping" during pan/zoom. Default is 200. public double VirtualizationBuffer { get; set; } Property Value double ZoomStep Zoom increment per scroll step. public double ZoomStep { get; set; } Property Value double

api/FlowGraph.Avalonia.Input.States.html.title: Namespace FlowGraph.Avalonia.Input.States | FlowGraph
api/FlowGraph.Avalonia.Input.States.html.summary: Namespace FlowGraph.Avalonia.Input.States Classes AnimatingNodesState Input state active during node animations (position transitions, appear/disappear effects). Allows viewport interactions (pan/zoom) while blocking node interactions. AnimatingState Input state used while animations are running. While active, user input is suppressed to prevent conflicts with animated transitions. AnimatingViewportState Input state active during viewport animations (pan/zoom transitions). Allows cancellation via click or key press, and permits zoom wheel interactions. BoxSelectingState State for box selection of multiple nodes. ConnectingState State for creating a new connection by dragging from a port. DraggingState State for dragging selected nodes. IdleState The default idle state - handles initial interactions and transitions to other states. PanningState State for panning the canvas viewport. ReconnectingState State for reconnecting an existing edge by dragging its endpoint. Similar to React Flow's reconnectable edges - the edge visual updates in real-time. ResizingState State for resizing a node via drag handles.

api/FlowGraph.Avalonia.Input.html.title: Namespace FlowGraph.Avalonia.Input | FlowGraph
api/FlowGraph.Avalonia.Input.html.summary: Namespace FlowGraph.Avalonia.Input Classes InputStateBase Base class for input states with default implementations. InputStateContext Shared context passed to all input states. Contains references to canvas components and raises events. InputStateMachine Manages input state transitions and delegates events to the current state. StateChangedEventArgs Event args for state changes. StateTransitionResult Represents the result of a state transition. Interfaces IInputState Base interface for all canvas input states. Implements the State Pattern for clean input handling.

api/FlowGraph.Avalonia.Rendering.DirectG.summary: Class DirectGraphRenderer Namespace FlowGraph.Avalonia.Rendering Assembly FlowGraph.Avalonia.dll A high-performance graph renderer that draws directly to a DrawingContext, bypassing the Avalonia visual tree for nodes and edges. This is optimized for large graphs (500+ nodes) where per-element Controls are too slow. api/FlowGraph.Avalonia.Rendering.GraphRe.summary: Class GraphRenderModel Namespace FlowGraph.Avalonia.Rendering Assembly FlowGraph.Avalonia.dll Central model that calculates all rendering geometry for a graph. This is the single source of truth for node bounds, port positions, edge paths, etc. Both VisualTree rendering and DirectDraw rendering use this model to ensure 100% visual parity. public class GraphRenderModel Inheritance object GraphRenderModel Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Examples var model = new GraphRenderModel(settings); // Get node bounds in canvas coordinates var bounds = model.GetNodeBounds(node); // Get port position var portPos = model.GetPortPosition(node, port, isOutput: true); // Calculate edge endpoints var (start, end) = model.GetEdgeEndpoints(edge, graph); Remarks The GraphRenderModel provides geometry calculations for: Node bounds and dimensions Port positions (supporting all 4 sides: Left, Right, Top, Bottom) Edge endpoints and bezier control points Group header and collapse button positions Resize handle positions Hit testing utilities By centralizing all geometry calculations here, both the visual tree renderer (NodeVisualManager) and the direct renderer (DirectGraphRenderer) produce identical visual output. api/FlowGraph.Avalonia.Rendering.NodeRen.title: Interface IDirectNodeRenderer | FlowGraph
api/FlowGraph.Avalonia.Rendering.NodeRen.summary: Interface IDirectNodeRenderer Namespace FlowGraph.Avalonia.Rendering.NodeRenderers Assembly FlowGraph.Avalonia.dll Interface for custom node renderers that support direct DrawingContext rendering. Implement this interface in addition to INodeRenderer to provide custom drawing logic for the high-performance DirectGraphRenderer mode. public interface IDirectNodeRenderer Examples public class MyCustomRenderer : INodeRenderer, IDirectNodeRenderer { // INodeRenderer implementation for visual tree mode public Control CreateNodeVisual(Node node, NodeRenderContext context) { ... } // IDirectNodeRenderer implementation for direct mode public void DrawNode(DrawingContext context, Node node, DirectNodeRenderContext ctx) { // Draw custom shape var geometry = new EllipseGeometry(ctx.ScreenBounds); context.DrawGeometry(ctx.Background, ctx.BorderPen, geometry); // Draw label if (!ctx.IsEditing) { // Draw text... } } } Remarks When DirectGraphRenderer renders a node, it first checks if the node's renderer implements IDirectNodeRenderer. If so, it delegates to DrawNode(DrawingContext, Node, DirectNodeRenderContext). Otherwise, it uses the built-in default drawing logic. Implementations should: - Draw node background and border - Draw node label (unless editingNodeId matches) - NOT draw ports (handled by DirectGraphRenderer for consistency) Methods DrawNode(DrawingContext, Node, DirectNodeRenderContext) Draws the node directly to a DrawingContext. void DrawNode(DrawingContext context, Node node, DirectNodeRenderContext renderContext) Parameters context DrawingContext The Avalonia drawing context. node Node The node to draw. renderContext DirectNodeRenderContext Context with pre-calculated screen bounds, brushes, and state.

api/FlowGraph.Avalonia.Rendering.NodeRen.title: Namespace FlowGraph.Avalonia.Rendering.NodeRenderers | FlowGraph
api/FlowGraph.Avalonia.Rendering.NodeRen.summary: Namespace FlowGraph.Avalonia.Rendering.NodeRenderers Classes DefaultNodeRenderer Default node renderer that creates a standard bordered box with text. Supports inline label editing via IEditableNodeRenderer. DirectNodeRenderContext Context passed to DrawNode(DrawingContext, Node, DirectNodeRenderContext) with pre-calculated values. GroupCollapseEventArgs Event args for group collapse toggle. GroupNodeRenderer Renderer for group nodes that contain other nodes. Uses a translucent background similar to React Flow's grouping style. Supports inline label editing via IEditableNodeRenderer. IMPORTANT: This renderer uses constants from GraphRenderModel to ensure 100% visual parity with DirectGraphRenderer. InputNodeRenderer Renderer for input nodes with a distinctive green color scheme. Displays a ">" icon and supports inline label editing. NodeRenderContext Context information passed to node renderers. NodeRendererRegistry Registry for custom node type renderers. Register custom renderers to handle specific node types. OutputNodeRenderer Renderer for output nodes with a distinctive red/coral color scheme. Displays a target/circle icon and supports inline label editing. SimplifiedNodeRenderer A simplified node renderer optimized for large graphs. Uses minimal visual elements for better performance with 500+ nodes. StyledNodeRendererBase Base class for styled node renderers with icon and label support. Provides customizable colors, icons (text or geometry), and inline editing. Override the abstract properties to customize appearance: - DefaultLabel: Default text when no label is set - GetNodeBackground(ThemeResources), GetNodeBorder(ThemeResources): Node colors - GetIconForeground(ThemeResources), GetTextForeground(ThemeResources): Text/icon colors For icons, override ONE of: - IconText: Simple text icon (e.g., ">", "O", "?") - IconGeometry: Vector path for scalable icons (compatible with any icon library) Using a Lucide icon path: // Get path data from any icon library (Lucide, Material, etc.) protected override Geometry? IconGeometry => Geometry.Parse("M5 12h14M12 5l7 7-7 7"); // arrow-right Interfaces IDirectNodeRenderer Interface for custom node renderers that support direct DrawingContext rendering. Implement this interface in addition to INodeRenderer to provide custom drawing logic for the high-performance DirectGraphRenderer mode. IEditableNodeRenderer Interface for node renderers that support inline label editing. INodeRenderer Interface for custom node renderers. Implement this interface to create custom visual representations for node types.

api/FlowGraph.Avalonia.Rendering.html.title: Namespace FlowGraph.Avalonia.Rendering | FlowGraph
api/FlowGraph.Avalonia.Rendering.html.summary: Namespace FlowGraph.Avalonia.Rendering Classes BezierHelper DirectGraphRenderer A high-performance graph renderer that draws directly to a DrawingContext, bypassing the Avalonia visual tree for nodes and edges. This is optimized for large graphs (500+ nodes) where per-element Controls are too slow. Uses GraphRenderModel for all geometry calculations to ensure 100% visual parity with the normal VisualTree renderer. EdgePathHelper Helper class for creating edge path geometries between points. EdgeVisualManager Manages rendering and tracking of edge visuals including paths, markers, and labels. Responsible for creating, updating, and removing edge UI elements. GraphRenderModel Central model that calculates all rendering geometry for a graph. This is the single source of truth for node bounds, port positions, edge paths, etc. Both VisualTree rendering and DirectDraw rendering use this model to ensure 100% visual parity. GraphRenderer Coordinates rendering of all graph elements (nodes, ports, edges, handles). Acts as a facade over specialized visual managers for clean separation of concerns. NodeVisualManager Manages rendering and tracking of node and port visuals. Responsible for creating, updating, and removing node/port UI elements. Uses GraphRenderModel for all geometry calculations to ensure visual parity with DirectGraphRenderer. RenderContext Shared rendering context containing settings, viewport state, and coordinate transformation utilities. Used by all visual managers to ensure consistent rendering behavior. ResizeHandleManager Manages rendering and tracking of resize handle visuals for nodes. Responsible for creating, updating, and removing resize handle UI elements. ThemeResources Provides theme-aware resource access for FlowCanvas components. All colors can be customized by defining resources in your App.axaml: <Application.Resources> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasNodeBackground" Color="#2D2D30"/> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasNodeBorder" Color="#4682B4"/> <!-- etc. --> </Application.Resources> Available resource keys: Canvas: FlowCanvasBackground, FlowCanvasGridColor Node: FlowCanvasNodeBackground, FlowCanvasNodeBorder, FlowCanvasNodeSelectedBorder, FlowCanvasNodeText Input Node: FlowCanvasInputNodeBackground, FlowCanvasInputNodeBorder, FlowCanvasInputNodeText, FlowCanvasInputNodeIcon Output Node: FlowCanvasOutputNodeBackground, FlowCanvasOutputNodeBorder, FlowCanvasOutputNodeText, FlowCanvasOutputNodeIcon Edge: FlowCanvasEdgeStroke, FlowCanvasEdgeSelectedStroke Port: FlowCanvasPortBackground, FlowCanvasPortBorder, FlowCanvasPortHover, FlowCanvasPortValidConnection, FlowCanvasPortInvalidConnection Group: FlowCanvasGroupBackground, FlowCanvasGroupBorder, FlowCanvasGroupLabelText Selection: FlowCanvasSelectionBoxFill, FlowCanvasSelectionBoxStroke Minimap: FlowCanvasMinimapBackground, FlowCanvasMinimapViewportFill, FlowCanvasMinimapViewportStroke Enums ResizeHandlePosition Positions for resize handles on a node.

api/FlowGraph.Avalonia.RouterAlgorithm.h.title: Enum RouterAlgorithm | FlowGraph
api/FlowGraph.Avalonia.RouterAlgorithm.h.summary: Enum RouterAlgorithm Namespace FlowGraph.Avalonia Assembly FlowGraph.Avalonia.dll Available edge routing algorithms. public enum RouterAlgorithm Fields Auto = 0 Automatically select the best router based on edge type. Direct = 1 Direct straight-line routing (no obstacle avoidance). Orthogonal = 2 Orthogonal routing with right-angle paths using A* pathfinding. SmartBezier = 3 Smart Bezier curves that avoid obstacles.

api/FlowGraph.Core.Commands.html.title: Namespace FlowGraph.Core.Commands | FlowGraph
api/FlowGraph.Core.Commands.html.summary: Namespace FlowGraph.Core.Commands Classes AddEdgeCommand Command to add an edge to the graph. AddNodeCommand Command to add a node to the graph. AddNodesToGroupCommand Command to add nodes to an existing group. AlreadyExecutedCommand Wraps a command that has already been executed, skipping the initial Execute call. Used when an action was performed through UI and we just need to track it for undo/redo. CommandHistory Manages command history for undo/redo functionality. CompositeCommand Command that groups multiple commands into a single undoable operation. DuplicateCommand Command to duplicate nodes and edges. GroupNodesCommand Command to group selected nodes into a new group. MoveNodesCommand Command to move one or more nodes to new positions. PasteCommand Command to paste nodes and edges from clipboard. RemoveEdgeCommand Command to remove an edge from the graph. RemoveEdgesCommand Command to remove multiple edges from the graph. RemoveNodeCommand Command to remove a node and its connected edges from the graph. RemoveNodesCommand Command to remove multiple nodes and their connected edges. RemoveNodesFromGroupCommand Command to remove nodes from their parent group. ResizeNodeCommand Command to resize a node. ToggleGroupCollapseCommand Command to toggle a group's collapsed state. UngroupNodesCommand Command to ungroup nodes from a group. Interfaces IGraphCommand Interface for reversible commands that support undo/redo.

api/index.html.title: API Reference | FlowGraph
api/index.html.summary: API Reference This section contains the auto-generated API documentation for FlowGraph. Namespaces FlowGraph.Core Core data models and commands (no UI dependencies). Graph - Main graph container Node - Node data model Edge - Edge/connection data model Port - Port data model FlowGraph.Avalonia Avalonia UI controls and rendering. FlowCanvas - Main canvas control FlowCanvasSettings - Configuration options FlowGraph.Avalonia.Controls UI components. FlowBackground - Background patterns FlowControls - Zoom controls FlowMinimap - Overview minimap FlowPanel - Positioned panels NodeToolbar - Node action toolbar FlowGraph.Avalonia.Rendering Rendering infrastructure. INodeRenderer - Node renderer interface DefaultNodeRenderer - Base renderer ThemeResources - Theme access Additional Documentation For tutorials and guides, visit flowgraph.prismify.co.

articles/getting-started.html.title: Getting Started | FlowGraph
articles/getting-started.html.summary: Getting Started This guide will help you set up FlowGraph in your Avalonia application. Prerequisites .NET 9.0 or later An Avalonia 11.2+ application Installation Add the NuGet package to your project: dotnet add package FlowGraph.Avalonia Basic Setup 1. Add Namespaces In your AXAML file, add the FlowGraph namespaces: <Window xmlns="https://github.com/avaloniaui" xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml" xmlns:fg="using:FlowGraph.Avalonia" xmlns:fgc="using:FlowGraph.Avalonia.Controls"> 2. Add the FlowCanvas <Panel> <fgc:FlowBackground x:Name="Background" Variant="Dots" Gap="20" /> <fg:FlowCanvas x:Name="Canvas" Graph="{Binding Graph}" /> </Panel> 3. Create a Graph In your ViewModel or code-behind: using FlowGraph.Core; public class MainViewModel { public Graph Graph { get; } = new Graph(); public MainViewModel() { // Create nodes var node1 = new Node { Type = "default", Position = new Point(100, 100), Label = "Node 1", Outputs = [new Port { Id = "out", Type = "data" }] }; var node2 = new Node { Type = "default", Position = new Point(350, 100), Label = "Node 2", Inputs = [new Port { Id = "in", Type = "data" }] }; Graph.AddNode(node1); Graph.AddNode(node2); // Connect nodes Graph.AddEdge(new Edge { Source = node1.Id, Target = node2.Id, SourcePort = "out", TargetPort = "in" }); } } 4. Connect Background to Canvas In your code-behind: public partial class MainWindow : Window { public MainWindow() { InitializeComponent(); Background.TargetCanvas = Canvas; } } Next Steps Custom Node Renderers Theming Animations API Reference

articles/guides/animations.html.title: Animations | FlowGraph
articles/guides/animations.html.summary: Animations FlowGraph provides a comprehensive animation system for smooth transitions and visual feedback. Viewport Animations // Fit all content in view canvas.FitToViewAnimated(duration: 0.5); // Center on a specific node canvas.CenterOnNodeAnimated(node, duration: 0.3); // Zoom to a specific level canvas.ZoomToAnimated(targetZoom: 1.5, duration: 0.2); // Pan to a position canvas.PanToAnimated(new Point(500, 300), duration: 0.3); Node Animations // Move nodes to new positions var positions = new Dictionary<string, Point> { { node1.Id, new Point(100, 100) }, { node2.Id, new Point(300, 100) } }; canvas.AnimateNodesTo(positions, duration: 0.3); // Appear animation (scale + fade) canvas.AnimateNodesAppear(nodes, duration: 0.3, stagger: 0.05); // Disappear animation canvas.AnimateNodesDisappear(nodes, duration: 0.2); // Selection pulse effect canvas.AnimateSelectionPulse(node); Edge Animations // Pulse effect canvas.AnimateEdgePulse(edge, pulseCount: 3); // Fade in/out canvas.AnimateEdgeFadeIn(edge, duration: 0.3); canvas.AnimateEdgeFadeOut(edge, duration: 0.3); // Color transition canvas.AnimateEdgeColor(edge, Colors.Red, duration: 0.5); // Continuous flow animation (data flow visualization) var animation = canvas.StartEdgeFlowAnimation(edge, speed: 50); // Later... canvas.StopEdgeFlowAnimation(animation); Group Animations // Animated collapse/expand canvas.AnimateGroupCollapse(groupId, duration: 0.5); canvas.AnimateGroupExpand(groupId, duration: 0.5); Animation Settings Configure animation behavior through settings: canvas.Settings.EnableAnimations = true; canvas.Settings.DefaultAnimationDuration = 0.3; Custom Animations For advanced use cases, access the animation manager directly: var animation = new GenericAnimation( duration: 0.5, easing: Easing.CubicOut, onUpdate: progress => { // Update properties based on progress (0.0 to 1.0) node.Opacity = progress; }, onComplete: () => { // Animation finished } ); canvas.AnimationManager.Start(animation);

articles/guides/custom-nodes.html.title: Custom Node Renderers | FlowGraph
articles/guides/custom-nodes.html.summary: Custom Node Renderers FlowGraph allows you to create custom node appearances by implementing the INodeRenderer interface or extending DefaultNodeRenderer. Basic Custom Renderer using Avalonia; using Avalonia.Controls; using Avalonia.Media; using FlowGraph.Avalonia.Rendering.NodeRenderers; using FlowGraph.Core; public class CustomNodeRenderer : DefaultNodeRenderer { private static readonly IBrush Background = new SolidColorBrush(Color.Parse("#E3F2FD")); private static readonly IBrush Border = new SolidColorBrush(Color.Parse("#2196F3")); public override Control CreateNodeVisual(Node node, NodeRenderContext context) { var control = base.CreateNodeVisual(node, context); if (control is Border border) { border.Background = Background; border.BorderBrush = Border; border.CornerRadius = new CornerRadius(12); } return control; } protected override string GetDisplayText(Node node) { return node.Label ?? node.Type ?? "Node"; } } Registering the Renderer canvas.NodeRenderers.Register("custom", new CustomNodeRenderer()); Using StyledNodeRendererBase For nodes with icons, extend StyledNodeRendererBase: public class MyNodeRenderer : StyledNodeRendererBase { // Use vector geometry for scalable icons private static readonly Geometry Icon = Geometry.Parse("M12 2L2 7l10 5 10-5-10-5z"); protected override Geometry? IconGeometry => Icon; protected override string DefaultLabel => "My Node"; protected override IBrush GetNodeBackground(ThemeResources theme) => new SolidColorBrush(Color.Parse("#FFF3E0")); protected override IBrush GetNodeBorder(ThemeResources theme) => new SolidColorBrush(Color.Parse("#FF9800")); protected override IBrush GetIconForeground(ThemeResources theme) => new SolidColorBrush(Color.Parse("#E65100")); protected override IBrush GetTextForeground(ThemeResources theme) => new SolidColorBrush(Color.Parse("#E65100")); } Icon Sources You can use path data from any icon library: Lucide Icons Material Design Icons Font Awesome Simply copy the SVG path data and use it with Geometry.Parse().

articles/guides/edge-routing.html.title: Edge Routing | FlowGraph
articles/guides/edge-routing.html.summary: Edge Routing FlowGraph supports multiple edge routing algorithms to control how edges are drawn between nodes. Edge Types Set the edge type when creating an edge: var edge = new Edge { Source = node1.Id, Target = node2.Id, SourcePort = "out", TargetPort = "in", Type = EdgeType.Bezier // Default }; Available Types Type Description EdgeType.Bezier Smooth curved path (default) EdgeType.Straight Direct line EdgeType.Step Right-angle path EdgeType.SmoothStep Rounded right-angle path Automatic Routing Enable automatic edge routing to avoid node overlaps: canvas.Settings.EnableEdgeRouting = true; canvas.Settings.DefaultEdgeRouter = EdgeRouterType.Orthogonal; Router Types Router Description EdgeRouterType.Direct Straight lines (no routing) EdgeRouterType.Orthogonal Right-angle paths with A* pathfinding EdgeRouterType.SmartBezier Bezier curves that avoid obstacles Manual Routing Trigger routing manually: // Route all edges canvas.Routing.RouteAllEdges(); // Route a specific edge canvas.Routing.RouteEdge(edgeId); Edge Markers Add arrow markers to edges: var edge = new Edge { Source = node1.Id, Target = node2.Id, SourcePort = "out", TargetPort = "in", MarkerEnd = EdgeMarker.Arrow, // Open arrow // or MarkerEnd = EdgeMarker.ArrowClosed // Filled arrow }; Edge Labels Add labels to edges: var edge = new Edge { Source = node1.Id, Target = node2.Id, SourcePort = "out", TargetPort = "in", Label = "Connection" }; Edge Reconnection Users can drag edge endpoints to reconnect them to different ports. This is enabled by default. // Disable reconnection canvas.Settings.EnableEdgeReconnection = false;

articles/guides/grouping.html.title: Node Grouping | FlowGraph
articles/guides/grouping.html.summary: Node Grouping Groups allow you to organize related nodes together. Groups can be collapsed, expanded, and nested. Creating Groups From Selected Nodes // Group currently selected nodes canvas.GroupSelected(); // With a custom label canvas.GroupSelected("Processing Pipeline"); Programmatically var group = new Node { Type = "group", IsGroup = true, Label = "My Group", Position = new Point(100, 100), Width = 400, Height = 300 }; graph.AddNode(group); // Add nodes to the group canvas.GroupManager.AddNodeToGroup(group.Id, node1.Id); canvas.GroupManager.AddNodeToGroup(group.Id, node2.Id); Collapse and Expand // Toggle collapse state canvas.ToggleGroupCollapse(groupId); // Explicit collapse/expand canvas.CollapseGroup(groupId); canvas.ExpandGroup(groupId); // With animation canvas.AnimateGroupCollapse(groupId, duration: 0.5); canvas.AnimateGroupExpand(groupId, duration: 0.5); Group Ports Groups can have input and output ports, allowing connections between the group and external nodes: var group = new Node { Type = "group", IsGroup = true, Label = "Pipeline", Position = new Point(100, 100), Width = 400, Height = 300, Inputs = [new Port { Id = "in", Type = "data", Label = "Input" }], Outputs = [new Port { Id = "out", Type = "data", Label = "Output" }] }; When a group is collapsed, edges connected to nodes inside the group are automatically re-routed to proxy ports on the group boundary. Managing Group Membership // Add node to group canvas.GroupManager.AddNodeToGroup(groupId, nodeId); // Remove node from group canvas.GroupManager.RemoveNodeFromGroup(nodeId); // Get group children var children = graph.GetGroupChildren(groupId); // Get all descendants (recursive) var allDescendants = graph.GetGroupChildrenRecursive(groupId); Ungrouping // Ungroup selected groups canvas.UngroupSelected(); // Programmatically canvas.GroupManager.Ungroup(groupId); Nested Groups Groups can contain other groups for hierarchical organization: var outerGroup = new Node { IsGroup = true, Label = "Outer" }; var innerGroup = new Node { IsGroup = true, Label = "Inner" }; graph.AddNode(outerGroup); graph.AddNode(innerGroup); canvas.GroupManager.AddNodeToGroup(outerGroup.Id, innerGroup.Id); canvas.GroupManager.AddNodeToGroup(innerGroup.Id, someNode.Id); Keyboard Shortcuts Shortcut Action Ctrl+G Group selected nodes Ctrl+Shift+G Ungroup selected group

articles/guides/index.html.title: Guides | FlowGraph
articles/guides/index.html.summary: Guides In-depth guides for FlowGraph features. Available Guides Custom Node Renderers - Create custom node appearances Theming - Customize colors and styles Animations - Add smooth transitions Grouping - Organize nodes into groups Edge Routing - Configure edge paths Serialization - Save and load graphs Additional Resources For full documentation and tutorials, visit flowgraph.prismify.co.

articles/guides/serialization.html.title: Serialization | FlowGraph
articles/guides/serialization.html.summary: Serialization FlowGraph supports JSON serialization for saving and loading graphs. Basic Usage using FlowGraph.Core.Serialization; // Serialize to JSON string string json = GraphSerializer.Serialize(graph); // Deserialize from JSON string Graph graph = GraphSerializer.Deserialize(json); File Operations Extension methods for file I/O: // Save to file graph.SaveToFile("my-graph.json"); // Load from file var graph = GraphExtensions.LoadFromFile("my-graph.json"); Cloning Create a deep copy of a graph: var copy = graph.Clone(); JSON Format The serialized format includes all graph data: { "nodes": [ { "id": "node-1", "type": "default", "label": "My Node", "position": { "x": 100, "y": 100 }, "width": 150, "height": 80, "inputs": [ { "id": "in", "type": "data", "label": "Input" } ], "outputs": [ { "id": "out", "type": "data", "label": "Output" } ], "data": { "customProperty": "value" } } ], "edges": [ { "id": "edge-1", "source": "node-1", "target": "node-2", "sourcePort": "out", "targetPort": "in", "type": "bezier", "label": "Connection" } ] } Custom Data Nodes support arbitrary data through the Data property: var node = new Node { Type = "custom", Position = new Point(100, 100), Data = new Dictionary<string, object> { { "value", 42 }, { "name", "Example" } } }; Custom data is preserved during serialization. Async Operations For large graphs, use async methods: // Async save await graph.SaveToFileAsync("large-graph.json"); // Async load var graph = await GraphExtensions.LoadFromFileAsync("large-graph.json");

articles/guides/theming.html.title: Theming | FlowGraph
articles/guides/theming.html.summary: Theming FlowGraph supports full theming through Avalonia's resource system. All colors can be customized by defining resources in your application. Theme Resources Define resources in your App.axaml: <Application.Resources> <!-- Canvas --> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasBackground" Color="#1E1E1E"/> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasGridColor" Color="#333333"/> <!-- Nodes --> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasNodeBackground" Color="#2D2D30"/> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasNodeBorder" Color="#4682B4"/> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasNodeSelectedBorder" Color="#FF6B00"/> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasNodeText" Color="#FFFFFF"/> <!-- Input Nodes --> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasInputNodeBackground" Color="#1B5E20"/> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasInputNodeBorder" Color="#4CAF50"/> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasInputNodeText" Color="#FFFFFF"/> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasInputNodeIcon" Color="#4CAF50"/> <!-- Output Nodes --> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasOutputNodeBackground" Color="#B71C1C"/> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasOutputNodeBorder" Color="#EF5350"/> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasOutputNodeText" Color="#FFFFFF"/> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasOutputNodeIcon" Color="#EF5350"/> <!-- Edges --> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasEdgeStroke" Color="#808080"/> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasEdgeSelectedStroke" Color="#FF6B00"/> <!-- Ports --> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasPortBackground" Color="#4682B4"/> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasPortBorder" Color="#FFFFFF"/> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasPortHover" Color="#FF6B00"/> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasPortValidConnection" Color="#22C55E"/> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasPortInvalidConnection" Color="#EF4444"/> <!-- Groups --> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasGroupBackground" Color="#18FFFFFF"/> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasGroupBorder" Color="#606060"/> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasGroupLabelText" Color="#B0B0B0"/> <!-- Selection --> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasSelectionBoxFill" Color="#204682B4"/> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasSelectionBoxStroke" Color="#4682B4"/> <!-- Minimap --> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasMinimapBackground" Color="#252526"/> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasMinimapViewportFill" Color="#304682B4"/> <SolidColorBrush x:Key="FlowCanvasMinimapViewportStroke" Color="#4682B4"/> </Application.Resources> Light and Dark Themes FlowGraph automatically detects light and dark themes via Avalonia's ActualThemeVariant. Default colors adjust based on the detected theme. To force a specific theme: Application.Current.RequestedThemeVariant = ThemeVariant.Dark; Accessing Theme Resources In custom renderers, use the ThemeResources class: public override Control CreateNodeVisual(Node node, NodeRenderContext context) { var background = context.Theme.NodeBackground; var border = context.Theme.NodeBorder; // ... } Available Resource Keys Category Keys Canvas FlowCanvasBackground, FlowCanvasGridColor Node FlowCanvasNodeBackground, FlowCanvasNodeBorder, FlowCanvasNodeSelectedBorder, FlowCanvasNodeText Input Node FlowCanvasInputNodeBackground, FlowCanvasInputNodeBorder, FlowCanvasInputNodeText, FlowCanvasInputNodeIcon Output Node FlowCanvasOutputNodeBackground, FlowCanvasOutputNodeBorder, FlowCanvasOutputNodeText, FlowCanvasOutputNodeIcon Edge FlowCanvasEdgeStroke, FlowCanvasEdgeSelectedStroke Port FlowCanvasPortBackground, FlowCanvasPortBorder, FlowCanvasPortHover, FlowCanvasPortValidConnection, FlowCanvasPortInvalidConnection Group FlowCanvasGroupBackground, FlowCanvasGroupBorder, FlowCanvasGroupLabelText Selection FlowCanvasSelectionBoxFill, FlowCanvasSelectionBoxStroke Minimap FlowCanvasMinimapBackground, FlowCanvasMinimapViewportFill, FlowCanvasMinimapViewportStroke

index.html.title: FlowGraph Documentation | FlowGraph
index.html.summary: FlowGraph Documentation A node-based graph editor for .NET and Avalonia. Quick Links Getting Started API Reference Guides About FlowGraph is a .NET library for building node-based editors, inspired by React Flow. It provides a complete set of tools for creating visual programming interfaces, workflow editors, and diagram applications. Features Pan, zoom, and viewport controls Draggable, resizable nodes with custom renderers Multiple edge types (Bezier, Straight, Step) Connection validation Undo/redo with full command history Copy, cut, paste, duplicate Node grouping with collapse/expand Minimap and controls Animations Theming support JSON serialization Installation dotnet add package FlowGraph.Avalonia Resources GitHub Repository NuGet Package Full Documentation (coming soon) License MIT License -  2026 Prismify LLC
